description: Primes p such that x^3 = 3 has no solution mod p.
comments: Primes of the form 7x^2+3xy+9y^2, whose discriminant is -243. - _T. D. Noe_, May 17 2005Complement of A040036 relative to A000040. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 17 2012
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: ok[p_]:= Reduce[Mod[x^3 - 3, p] == 0, x, Integers] == False;Select[Prime[Range[200]], ok] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 17 2012  *)
prog: (MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(1000) | not exists{x : x in ResidueClassRing(p) | x^3 eq 3} ]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 17 2012(PARI) forprime(p=2,10^3,if(#polrootsmod(x^3-3,p)==0,print1(p,", "))) \\ _Joerg Arndt_, Jul 16 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
